description: Erection of part three and four storey building containing 14 flats (12 x bed room and 2 x 3 bedroom) with 10 car parking spaces, including 2 disabled spaces, storage for 16 cycles , landscaping and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  The development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.4, 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | No development shall take place until a schedule of landscape maintenance for a minimum period of 5 years from the implementation of final planting  has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Landscape maintenance shall be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule.  REASON: To protect the landscaping in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | No development shall take place on site until such time as the details of any services, excavations or any other works to be undertaken within the crown spread and vicinity of the trees to be retained on and adjacent to the site shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and the necessary works shall be undertaken in accordance with the agreed detail.  REASON: To provide sufficient protection for the trees to be retained in the interests of the visual amenity of the locality and in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines' | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment (including any internal fences, walls and railings to the roof terrace areas) to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and completed prior to the occupation of the units and permanently retained thereafter.   REASON: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of the prospective residents and neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The cycle parking shown on the approved plans, shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To provide and retain adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy  9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The car parking spaces and associated access areas shown on the approved plans (PL)001and (PL)010 shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking, and shall not be used for any other purpose.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking, in accordance with policies 1.9, 9.1 and 9.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | No development shall take place until such time as a tree report and survey to BS5837 2005 standard has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority as well as method statement for demolitiion and construction within tree protection zones. Details of the works necessary to protect the trees to be retained within and adjacent to the site shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development and the approved details shall be implemented prior to commencement of the development and retained until it is completed.  No materials, plant, other equipment, storage or other works shall take place at any time within the enclosed area around the trees to be retained.   REASON: To provide sufficient protection for the trees to be retained in the interests of the visual amenity of the locality and in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | Details of measures for protecting the building envelope (roof, walls and windows) of the residential units from external noise, vibration and odour, including aircraft noise and internal separation between the ground floor refuse storage area and the residential units, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The works shall be carried out as approved before first occupation and shall thereafter be retained.  REASON: To protect the amenities  and the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential units, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration' | Details of energy efficient design and consideration of on-site equipment for renewable power generation for the buildings so that at least 10% of all energy requirements within the resulting development are sourced from renewable energy resources, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure that the development incorporates energy efficiency measures, in accordance with policy 2.9 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of crime prevention and security measures for the buildings, car parking areas,  cycle parking areas (including access controls to the car park and entrance doors), hard and soft landscaped areas and bin storage areas, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development. The details shall comply with the aims and objectives of the Police requirements of Secured By Design. The approved details shall be implemented before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: To ensure that the development achieves the required crime prevention elements and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 4.3 and 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary | 	Prior to the commencement of any development, details of a site construction method statement/ management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The method statement/management plan shall include the following:  -    on-site construction worker parking -    anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site -   delivery times (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods) -   dust suppression measures -    wheel washing provisions -    site security -    vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including sweep path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear. -   details as to the location(s) for the storage of building materials and construction debris -   procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.  Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  REASON :  To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and ensure adequate highway and site safety, in accordance with adopted UDP policies 4.4, 4.5, 4.11, 9.1 and 9.9. | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed by the local planning authority.    REASON: To ensure access for all future occupiers in accordance with policy 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | Prior to the commencement of any works on site, the applicant shall carry out a contaminated land investigation that shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Sampling points and methods of investigation shall be agreed in writing with the Principal Environmental Health Officer prior to the investigation and if deemed necessary by the Local Planning Authority, a scheme shall be submitted for the removal, neutralising and sealing of the contamination, and the approved remedial works shall be implemented before building works commence.  REASON: To ensure that the site is not hazardous, in accordance with policy 2.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding any details as shown on the approved plans no balconies or terraces shall be created on the North elevation of the residential units.  REASON: To prevent overlooking of neighbouring properties and to accord with Policy 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
